# Exploring the Different Panel Types Used in 4K Monitors: IPS vs TN vs VA

## Introduction
- Brief overview of the importance of panel technology in 4K monitors
- Explanation of the three main panel types: IPS, TN, and VA

## IPS (In-Plane Switching) Panels
- Description of IPS technology and how it works
- Advantages of IPS panels, such as superior color accuracy and wide viewing angles
- Disadvantages of IPS panels, such as slower response times and higher cost

## TN (Twisted Nematic) Panels
- Description of TN technology and how it differs from IPS
- Advantages of TN panels, such as fast response times and lower cost
- Disadvantages of TN panels, such as poor color accuracy and limited viewing angles

## VA (Vertical Alignment) Panels
- Description of VA technology and its unique features
- Advantages of VA panels, such as high contrast ratios and deep blacks
- Disadvantages of VA panels, such as slower response times and potential ghosting effects

## Conclusion
- Summary of the key differences between IPS, TN, and VA panels
- Recommendations for different use cases based on panel technology preferences
